alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Meade (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 24 at 10:00PM EDT until March 25 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT/3 AM CDT/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Indiana and Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Indiana, Crawford, Dubois, Harrison, Orange, Perry, Scott and Washington. In Kentucky, Breckinridge, Hancock and Meade. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EDT /300 AM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 PM EDT /900 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tell City, Salem, Corydon, Hardinsburg, Hawesville, English, Carefree Town, Mount Pleasant, Webster and Lewisport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
